Title: Chaos Machine
Book Description: This customizable marble roller coaster is a perennial favorite- serving as a metaphor for the open source development process. The Chaos Machine is available all weekend for Penguicon attendees to tinker with!

Title: Free Fates Fortune Telling Booth
Book Description: Find a token- bring it to the booth in the lobby- and randomly generated predictions will be given to you! You may also write a short question and receive a Yes or No answer in return. Hours of operation posted at the booth.

Title: Giant Jenga
Book Description: Stop by and play some (enormous) Jenga with your friends- or meet new people. No writing dirty things on the blocks! You'll just have to use your imagination.

Title: NUET Scouts
Presenters: Justin Coluzzi, Kevin McLeod, Alex Drummer
Book Description: The Scouts are at it again! The Nearly Useless Entertainment Team is back for another year at Penguicon- bringing you fun- mayhem- and shenanigans. Find us wandering the con to see what we have planned this year.

Title: Pengicon Picture Bingo
Book Description: Snap a picture of each clue and you will be rewarded! Go to Registration- Ops- or the Greeter Table to get started!

Title: Pirate Sea Chanties!
Book Description: Rathbone the Pirate will enchant us with authentic sea chanties throughout the weekend!

Title: Ribbon Fairies
Book Description: Look out for the Ribbon Fairies! If you find them- you can trade them a ribbon for a ribbon!

Title: Where in the World?
Book Description: Wondering where people are coming from to go to Penguicon?  Stop by and tag the city you came from on the World- US or Michigan map!

Title: One Night Werewolf
Book Description: 3-7 players. Fast deduction game in which everyone gets one of a dozen different roles- each with a special ability. In the course of a single morning- your village will decide who is a werewolf...because all it takes is lynching one werewolf to win!

Title: Rathbone vs. Everybody
Book Description: Avast! Rathbone the Pirate will simultaneously compete against all of you swabs- playing several different games from the age of piracy! (Attention: When a pirate cheats- it is only illegal if the pirate gets caught at it. This has been an advisory of the Caribbean Warning System.)

Title: Arkham Horror
Book Description: A cooperative adventure game themed around H.P Lovecraft's Cthulhu Mythos. It's up to the Investigators to prevent one of the eight Ancient Ones from breaking into our world. During the course of the game- players will upgrade with skills- allies- items- weapons- and spells. It's up to the players to clean out the streets of Arkham by fighting many different types of monsters- but their main goal is to close portals to other dimensions that are opening up around town. With too many portals open the Ancient One awakens and the players only have one last chance to save the world. Defeat the Ancient One in combat!

Title: Authentic Pirate Games
Book Description: Learn several card games and board games from the late 17th and early 18th centuries.

Title: Are You A Werewolf
Book Description: A deception party game for 7-15 players. Players are assigned roles secretly. Most players are Villagers- two or three will be Werewolves. The Villagers try to figure out who the werewolves are during the day- and the Werewolves eat the Villagers at night.

Title: Hakosot
Book Description: 'SAVE- YOUR- DIXIE CUPS- 'CAUSE WE'RE GONNA PLAY HAKOSOT! SAVE- YOUR- DIXIE CUPS- 'CAUSE WE'RE GONNA PLAY HAKOSOT!' Grab all your friends- and play this game of singing while passing cups.
